subject: Add support for JWKS based OAuth Token validation.
messages: [{'account_id': 14369, 'date': '2020-03-11 08:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-11 13:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-12 15:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-11 08:48:09.000000000', 'message': "Add support for JWKS based OAuth Token validation.

Keycloak only enables the introspection API when using a 'confidential'
client.  This means that for user initiated OAuth2 tokens the user would
need to know the secrets for a client (ie the confidential piece).

With Keycloak to use a 'public' client, where the user doesn't need to
know a client secret, you need to use a JWKS to validate the JWT tokens
instead of the introspection endpoint.  OIDCOAuthVerifyJwksUri tells
mod_auth_openidc where to find that certificate.  You also need to
*remove* OIDCOAuthIntrospectionEndpoint as this conflicts with
OIDCOAuthVerifyJwksUri

Change-Id: I95220db87f61ca19e50c64b4f799d3973b256858
(cherry picked from commit 6d6860ac4965e528a7f858c8b970964cbbaba0aa)
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for JWKS based OAuth Token validation.

Keycloak only enables the introspection API when using a 'confidential'
client.  This means that for user initiated OAuth2 tokens the user would
need to know the secrets for a client (ie the confidential piece).

With Keycloak to use a 'public' client, where the user doesn't need to
know a client secret, you need to use a JWKS to validate the JWT tokens
instead of the introspection endpoint.  OIDCOAuthVerifyJwksUri tells
mod_auth_openidc where to find that certificate.  You also need to
*remove* OIDCOAuthIntrospectionEndpoint as this conflicts with
OIDCOAuthVerifyJwksUri

Change-Id: I95220db87f61ca19e50c64b4f799d3973b256858
(cherry picked from commit 6d6860ac4965e528a7f858c8b970964cbbaba0aa)

commit_message:
OIDC : Add support for setting OIDCClaimDelimiter

Depending on the configuration of the IdP and keystone, without
setting the claim delimiter it's not possible to use multi-value
claims.

Change-Id: I0cfc0d693a5fe2815bf5f6fd5acd038db2fe4dd3
(cherry picked from commit a7843f0660467e75fbb79f1f3de03ab99168fb4f)

commit_message:
Use a fake zuul_return and an .ansible-lint file

ansible-lint now supports settings in a file, including exclude_paths.
This lets us simplfy the ansible-lint command. Also, stop installing
zuul and just use a fake zuul_return to fake out ansible-lint.

Change-Id: I40291d4e861fe9e6e3341b075ab7d6c9f5315275

commit_message:
Remove mirror-info role and tests

This is in opendev/base-jobs, so we don't need a second copy over

[{'created': '2020-03-12 00:22:20.000000000', 'message': "Extend power sync timeout for Ericsson SDI

Ericsson SDI uses cached power state data in what is returned
to the API user, and typically this takes longer than 30 seconds
to provide an updated value to the API user.

As such, if we do not extend the timeout value, such users of

Change-Id: I0aa5131504b60b13d43c73c9a3be1f50f7855cbc
"}]
commit_message:
Extend power sync timeout for Ericsson SDI

Ericsson SDI uses cached power state data in what is returned
to the API user, and typically this takes longer than 30 seconds
to provide an updated value to the API user.

As such, if we do not extend the timeout value, such users of
Ironic's Redfish API interface will have deployments fail as
the power state timeout will be encountered.

Change-Id: I0aa5131504b60b13d43c73c9a3be1f50f7855cbc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-04 11:26:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix AttributeError in negotiate_version

Seen in kolla-ansible CI, if ironic inspector starts up before ironic
API is properly up, we see the following error:

The PXE filter DnsmasqFilter, state=initialized encountered an
exception: StrictVersion instance has no attribute 'version'; resetting
the filter: AttributeError: StrictVersion instance has no attribute
'version'

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/756342/

The usual cause of this error is when StrictVersion is initialised with
a version of None. This suggests to me that max_ver is None.

This leads to an exception being raised that circumvents the client's
retry mechanisms.

In the particular case of kolla-ansible CI, Ironic API is behind a load
balancer, and all backends are down resulting in a 503. The lack of a
retry caused ironic inspector to fail on startup.

This patch catches the case where we get a 4xx or 5xx return code when
checking the version, and raises an error that works with the client's
retry mechanisms.

Change-Id: Ib62ca3ee4626084e5e9b90e93e4fa97938023457
Story: 2006393
Task: 36266
(cherry picked from commit 0e9bf337f1f6aa41f67df2966dacf9e8e897b7da)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in negotiate_version

Seen in kolla-ansible CI, if ironic inspector starts up before ironic
API is properly up, we see the following error:

The PXE filter DnsmasqFilter, state=initialized encountered an
exception: StrictVersion instance has no attribute 'version'; resetting
the filter: AttributeError: StrictVersion instance has no attribute
'version'

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/756342/

The usual cause of this error is when StrictVersion is initialised with
a version of None. This suggests to me that max_ver is None.

This leads to an exception being raised that circumvents the client's
retry mechanisms.

In the particular case of kolla-ansible CI, Ironic API is behind a load
balancer, and all backends are down resulting in a 503. The lack of a
retry caused ironic inspector to fail on startup.

This patch catches the case where we get a 4xx or 5xx return code when
checking the version, and raises an error that works with the client's
retry mechanisms.

Change-Id: Ib62ca3ee4626084e5e9b90e93e4fa97938023457
Story: 2006393
Task: 36266
(cherry picked from commit 0e9bf337f1f6aa41f67df2966dacf9e8e897b7da)

commit_message:
Add support for additional volume backup options

This adds support for creating incremental volume backups and volume
backups from snapshot to the cloud layer.

Change-Id: I8516b63289d18587a5e4d17216393e18d2460211

commit_message:
[manila] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ifeb733b4d137c12176fba556acb00717731a0219
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Check Ceph*Key value format and halt on error

The CephX keys secret is expected to have a specific format, this
adds a constraint in the templates to ensure it has the correct
format.

Change-Id: Ic12c3c287a921d696de1395bc887691c48146359
Closes-Bug: 1864185
(cherry picked from commit 0940dfd95ef64cb4d1d87edfe74374b08db9c9f2)
(cherry picked from commit 33ce60d6acafc8e06b42366a7ef873871597a736)
(cherry picked from commit 98652da2ab272c8919a31348a4e7f6f33b8321c9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-12 14:59:57.000000000', 'message': 'Force Python 2 for virtualenvs on CentOS 7

Something has changed in the OpenDev infra that means that virtualenv is
now installed via Python 3 on CentOS 7. This means that if the Python
version is not specified, it will be created using Python 3. This will
not work for us on CentOS 7. This is probably caused by [1], although it
is not clear why it did not affect us sooner.

This change uninstalls virtualenv for Python 3, and reinstalls
virtualenv for Python 2 on CentOS 7.

[1] https://opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/commit/e88b96b5feba26cbdfa349cd788a53985d4b409a

Change-Id: Ib1291a91dfdb73b2c5e7b68afbc4eff083642727
'}]
commit_message:
Force Python 2 for virtualenvs on CentOS 7

Something has changed in the OpenDev infra that means that virtualenv is
now installed via Python 3 on CentOS 7. This means that if the Python
version is not specified, it will be created using Python 3. This will
not work for us on CentOS 7. This is probably caused by [1], although it
is not clear why it did not affect us sooner.

This change uninstalls virtualenv for Python 3, and reinstalls
virtualenv for Python 2 on CentOS 7.

[1] https://opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/commit/e88b96b5feba26cbdfa349cd788a53985d4b409a

Change-Id: Ib1291a91dfdb73b2c5e7b68afbc4eff083642727

commit_message:
Don't DEBUG log django.template by default

It's sprinkled with exception handling, making the logs rather
unreadable.

Change-Id: Ifb42af60b4a08a6b06d52197d12a961aaf13bc84
Related-Bug: #1720893
(cherry picked from commit 4c64c62e0b8bdd56679c182f7a2b48b6e5a87f45)

commit_message:
Make scenario010 voting

Octavia jobs should be voting, we are merging a bunch of patches for
Octavia and they should be properly tested. If something is broken in
the job, it should be fixed; and not ignored by a non voting job.

This patch switches voting to True for
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone.

Note about tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario010-ovn-provider-standalone:
the job is being converted to run tempest and is still WIP so it'll vote
later.

Change-Id: I85fdc2fae66b95a194fd3a5da851f702c9dcec1e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-06 14:49:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pip2 install without upper constraints

Without this we get the following error:

ERROR: No matching distribution found for gitdb>=4.0.1
(from gitdb2>=2.0.0->GitPython<2.1.12,>=1.0.1->kolla==9.0.1)

This is because gitdb has dropped support for Python 2.

Adding an upper limit to requirements.txt for gitdb2 matching train
upper constraints fixes the issue.

Change-Id: If73c419bf13866507a8258dca6d4ae30c5177ba9
Closes-Bug: #1866360
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pip2 install without upper constraints

Without this we get the following error:

ERROR: No matching distribution found for gitdb>=4.0.1
(from gitdb2>=2.0.0->GitPython<2.1.12,>=1.0.1->kolla==9.0.1)

This is because gitdb has dropped support for Python 2.

Adding an upper limit to requirements.txt for gitdb2 matching train
upper constraints fixes the issue.

Change-Id: If73c419bf13866507a8258dca6d4ae30c5177ba9
Closes-Bug: #1866360

[{'created': '2020-01-29 10:14:59.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Add an interval between agents health checks

This patch adds a minimum interval between each agent health checks.

The way OVN checks for the agents liveness is by increasing a value in
the NB DB and waiting for it to be propagated to the SB DB but, this can
be costy if done many times too quickly. Therefore, a minimum interval
between each check is being added.

(Cherry-picked from Neutron If1f2d97e3a3a17f6744d546b3e8903bde55e83b9)

Change-Id: Ie54bead54fc6c1be718abe54939b158d23c535c1
Closes-Bug: #1861092
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Add an interval between agents health checks

This patch adds a minimum interval between each agent health checks.

The way OVN checks for the agents liveness is by increasing a value in
the NB DB and waiting for it to be propagated to the SB DB but, this can
be costy if done many times too quickly. Therefore, a minimum interval
between each check is being added.

(Cherry-picked from Neutron If1f2d97e3a3a17f6744d546b3e8903bde55e83b9)

Change-Id: Ie54bead54fc6c1be718abe54939b158d23c535c1
Closes-Bug: #1861092
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix for BufferedReader sets is_zero_size true for a chunk

When the image is size larger than chunk size, swift store
uploads 0 bytes for swift_buffered_upload enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1863691

Change-Id: I272d380d8fc093e946ecd6bd5ba99b5bbe2409b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-12 11:48:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add server specific backend options

Ability to add per server backend options to backend nodes.
For example if adding cookies for persistance:
haproxy_service_configs:
  ...
  - service:
      haproxy_service_name: serviceX
      ...
      haproxy_backend_nodes:
        - name: serverA
          ip_addr: 192.168.1.1
          backend_server_options:
            - "check cookie serverA"
        - name: serverB
          ip_addr: 192.168.1.2
          backend_server_options:
            - "check cookie serverB"
      haproxy_backend_arguments:
        - "cookie SERVERID insert indirect nocache"
      haproxy_backend_server_options:
        - "inter 3000"
   ...
Then the templated out server lines would look like:
server serverA 192.168.1.1 ... inter 3000 check cookie serverA
server serverB 192.168.1.2 ... inter 3000 check cookie serverB

Change-Id: Ief39bd50549c64f5f8d34e143acccf25dbbce299
'}]
commit_message:
Add server specific backend options

Ability to add per server backend options to backend nodes.
For example if adding cookies for persistance:
haproxy_service_configs:
  ...
  - service:
      haproxy_service_name: serviceX
      ...
      haproxy_backend_nodes:
        - name: serverA
          ip_addr: 192.168.1.1
          backend_server_options:
            - "check cookie serverA"
        - name: serverB
          ip_addr: 192.168.1.2
          backend_server_options:
            - "check cookie serverB"
      haproxy_backend_arguments:
        - "cookie SERVERID insert indirect nocache"
      haproxy_backend_server_options:
        - "inter 3000"
   ...
Then the templated out server lines would look like:
server serverA 192.168.1.1 ... inter 3000 check cookie serverA
server serverB 192.168.1.2 ... inter 3000 check cookie serverB

Change-Id: Ief39bd50549c64f5f8d34e143acccf25dbbce299

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-12 09:24:46.000000000', 'message': "Change force_raw_images to use sha256 if md5 is selected

In order to enable ironic's conductor to execute on nodes
set for FIPS 140-2 compliance, we need to not explicitly
choose MD5.

In the case of forcing images to raw, we were calculating
the checksum at least once, if not twice. Now we will honor
the original algorithm unless it is MD5, at which point we
will default to SHA3-256, and only recalculate the checksum
once.

Change-Id: I408a2e461bebf1f6d9fa3e350eb7ab1a3544adad
Story: 2007306
Task: 38791
(cherry picked from commit 06c59972674f063a84307b2d954f9a6013d66ccb)
"}]
commit_message:
Change force_raw_images to use sha256 if md5 is selected

In order to enable ironic's conductor to execute on nodes
set for FIPS 140-2 compliance, we need to not explicitly
choose MD5.

In the case of forcing images to raw, we were calculating
the checksum at least once, if not twice. Now we will honor
the original algorithm unless it is MD5, at which point we
will default to SHA3-256, and only recalculate the checksum
once.

Change-Id: I408a2e461bebf1f6d9fa3e350eb7ab1a3544adad
Story: 2007306
Task: 38791
(cherry picked from commit 06c59972674f063a84307b2d954f9a6013d66ccb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-25 22:05:29.000000000', 'message': 'Switch senlin-dashboard to cycle-with-rc

Deliverables following the cycle-with-intermediary model are expected
to release multiple times throughout the development cycle. Since
senlin-dashboard only released once last cycle, and has not done a release
yet this cycle, this proposes changing the release model to cycle-with-rc
so the expectation is only that it will release an RC by the end of
the cycle prior to doing the final release.

For the team, please respond to this patch in one of the following ways:

* -1 this patch and follow up with an intermediary release
* +1 this patch and we will switch over the release model
* -1 this patch, but acknowledge a release will be done prior to the
  RC1 deadline.

Change-Id: I3a3fdf8ed1fccff4090c7e3c144ade52ab8d1167
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch senlin-dashboard to cycle-with-rc

Deliverables following the cycle-with-intermediary model are expected
to release multiple times throughout the development cycle. Since
senlin-dashboard only released once last cycle, and has not done a release
yet this cycle, this proposes changing the release model to cycle-with-rc
so the expectation is only that it will release an RC by the end of
the cycle prior to doing the final release.

For the team, please respond to this patch in one of the following ways:

* -1 this patch and follow up with an intermediary release
* +1 this patch and we will switch over the release model
* -1 this patch, but acknowledge a release will be done prior to the
  RC1 deadline.

Change-Id: I3a3fdf8ed1fccff4090c7e3c144ade52ab8d1167
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix logging of console output in scenario tests

In patch [1] there was added logging of VM's console output if
connectivity will fail.
But in some cases wrong dict was passed to check_remote_connectivity()
method and that caused failure on logging console output.
This patch fixes this issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697980/

Change-Id: I60c30bd33f3b76873268a5e2e7e1960357c65720

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I81a9af2000fbadaefc00875aecfa4e2beed86485

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: Ifd8948f8a0fcdbfa334cd2bfc179b6cc00241a7a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-11 13:50:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HAProxy monitor VIP precheck

If haproxy is running somewhere in the cluster and listening on the VIP,
but not running locally, then the following precheck may fail:

   TASK [haproxy : Checking free port for HAProxy monitor (vip interface)]

   msg: Timeout when waiting for 192.0.2.10:61313 to stop.

This change fixes the issue by skipping the check if HAProxy is running
on any host.

Change-Id: I831eb2f700ef3fcf65b7e08382c3b4fcc4ce8d8d
Closes-Bug: #1866617
(cherry picked from commit 93a4dcc1b97b1d7bbd3b91cc9c4bd4617ec6f9ba)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HAProxy monitor VIP precheck

If haproxy is running somewhere in the cluster and listening on the VIP,
but not running locally, then the following precheck may fail:

   TASK [haproxy : Checking free port for HAProxy monitor (vip interface)]

   msg: Timeout when waiting for 192.0.2.10:61313 to stop.

This change fixes the issue by skipping the check if HAProxy is running
on any host.

Change-Id: I831eb2f700ef3fcf65b7e08382c3b4fcc4ce8d8d
Closes-Bug: #1866617
(cherry picked from commit 93a4dcc1b97b1d7bbd3b91cc9c4bd4617ec6f9ba)

commit_message:
Add config option 'ovsdb_retry_max_interval'

Different environment may have different needs for the max interval
of each retry, so it is better to make this parameter be configurable.

Change-Id: Ib0787ebd58e62d923908b4606cca5837a01f5871
(cherry picked from commit 8542ed404130bad07ff65b277f8d6e54898694b5)

commit_message:
Add a validation to fail if a Ceph dependency is not installed

When the overcloud is deployed with Ceph we need to install all the
ceph dependencies on the overcloud nodes.
If a ceph dependency is missing, a warning message is displayed and we
can also let the playbook fail setting the related boolean.
Furthermore, if the package is found, the playbook check if a new
version is available.

Closes-Bug: 1855692
Change-Id: I85d09955e839bab35cc06d2f0906f3012c8a1aa9
(cherry picked from commit 7fe786039b77c03fdd984e161b7aeccb78be9f1e)

commit_message:
Ensure enabled_services is a list, not a string

The command/register method of getting the enabled
services from hiera produced not a list of services
but a list containing only one string of concatenated
services. E.g. ["[svc1],[svc2]"], not ["svc1","svc2"].
Because the desired data is already in the hieradata
directory as JSON, parse the JSON to extract the list.
Also, update the method of determining if an item is
in a list.

Change-Id: I56ea7918fc023fd200989f143109c341ce0b18ba
Closes-Bug: #1867004

commit_message:
Add a new set of tasks to build the openstack pool and key list

Using this approach we can build the list of the openstack
pools and keys according to the tht variable generated and
the list of the enabled services gathered by hiera.

Closes-Bug: #1864477
Change-Id: I80ac1fc325a2d13be1a1e454eee0389510c090b2
(cherry picked from commit 144f5aa690eb2c6ea6071dc2732c721e6bde4c77)

commit_message:
Add CephBasePoolVars and CephKeyVars structures

This patch introduces CephBasePoolVars and CephKeyVars
structures which are used to handle the pool and keys
related ceph variables.
This change also sets the tripleo-ansible facts needed
to move the logic of building 'openstack_pools' and
'openstack_keys' arrays in tripleo-ansible.
The resulting structures will be merged/combined then
with the main 'ceph_ansible_group_vars_all' (all.yaml)
provided by ceph-base.

Closes-Bug: #1864477
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709083
Change-Id: Ic241d8fe9e09075fadd1f96b329e8a5c9eb0a9ff

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-21 10:11:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm working first to move on tripleo_ansible the t-h-t code that allow us to generate the pool list.
This is the basic flow / structure, and my idea is based on the following assumptions:

1. create a different set of structures on tht (a structure for keys, one for pools and so on..)
2. create a specific pool (or key) according to the enabled_services gathered from hiera

John/Giulio: it's still a WIP and I like to collect some ideas to improve our code.

In the next PS I'm going to add:

1. pool name / application parameters
2. tht change to generate the pool params from a dedicated structure"}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-21 10:21:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm working first to move on tripleo_ansible the t-h-t code that

 > John/Giulio: it's still a WIP and I like to collect some ideas to
 > improve our code.
 > 
 > In the next PS I'm going to add:
 > 
 > 1. pool name / application parameters
 > 2. tht change to generate the pool params from a dedicated
 > structure

oh and of course add extra pool generation support."}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-21 10:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-21 10:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-21 10:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-22 16:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-22 19:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-22 20:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-02-23 16:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Looks good so far. Keep going with it. I have a few suggestions for things I think you're missing at the moment.

Please put this and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709297 under the same topic with a meaningful name. We have a downstream bug that too many unwanted pools are getting created. You could open a corresponding upstream bug X and make "bug/X" the optic for both patches and then link them to the downstream bug.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-23 16:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-02-23 16:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

 > Looks good so far. Keep going with it. I have a few suggestions for
 > things I think you're missing at the moment.
 > 
 > Please put this and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709297 under the
 > same topic with a meaningful name. We have a downstream bug that
 > too many unwanted pools are getting created. You could open a

commit_message:
Add a new set of tasks to build the openstack pool and key list

Using this approach we can build the list of the openstack
pools and keys according to the tht variable generated and
the list of the enabled services gathered by hiera.

Closes-Bug: #1864477
Change-Id: I80ac1fc325a2d13be1a1e454eee0389510c090b2

[{'account_id': 30729, 'date': '2019-07-22 12:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-22 12:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
connectors/nvme: Wait until nvme device shows up in kernel

When using nvme connect NNMe device
does not show up immediately in kernel.

Change-Id: I5f34793e29bd91f3312aaf6f42866c2f2c0b2494
Signed-off-by: Pawel Kaminski <pawelx.kaminski@intel.com>

CentOS 8 removes interfaces from their bridge during ifdown, and removes
the bridge if there are no interfaces left. When Kayobe bounces veth

are using for SSH to be removed. Use a dummy interface in CI to avoid

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Add seed and overcloud CI jobs, drop CentOS 7 jobs

CentOS 8 removes interfaces from their bridge during ifdown, and removes
the bridge if there are no interfaces left. When Kayobe bounces veth
links plugged into the bridge, it causes the bridge which has the IP we
are using for SSH to be removed. Use a dummy interface in CI to avoid
this problem.

Kolla-ansible has dropped all CentOS 7 jobs on master now, and prechecks
only allow CentOS 7 hosts. Drop all CentOS 7 jobs. We will have to run
without upgrade jobs in place until Train supports CentOS 8.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/695881

Change-Id: I7c1a885b36445e33d4db1b1c8533db28a644b4a1
Story: 2006574
Task: 38870

commit_message:
Swift: remove meta field from rsync command

Remove the {meta} from the default settings in the account, container
and object services templates.

Change-Id: I079fddf8feb020bed93bf44b8aaec0882823e15c
Closes-Bug: #1862058

Use internal API for masakari-monitor

By default api_interface is set to public, masakari-monitor
on compute nodes should communicate via the internal API to
reach masakari-api.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-25 22:06:25.000000000', 'message': 'Switch tacker-horizon to cycle-with-rc

Deliverables following the cycle-with-intermediary model are expected
to release multiple times throughout the development cycle. Since
tacker-horizon only released once last cycle, and has not done a release
yet this cycle, this proposes changing the release model to cycle-with-rc
so the expectation is only that it will release an RC by the end of
the cycle prior to doing the final release.

For the team, please respond to this patch in one of the following ways:

* -1 this patch and follow up with an intermediary release
* +1 this patch and we will switch over the release model
* -1 this patch, but acknowledge a release will be done prior to the
  RC1 deadline.

Change-Id: I3a553d7cb7922ff90ba2b099e023af92a8a85fa9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch tacker-horizon to cycle-with-rc

Deliverables following the cycle-with-intermediary model are expected
to release multiple times throughout the development cycle. Since
tacker-horizon only released once last cycle, and has not done a release
yet this cycle, this proposes changing the release model to cycle-with-rc
so the expectation is only that it will release an RC by the end of
the cycle prior to doing the final release.

For the team, please respond to this patch in one of the following ways:

* -1 this patch and follow up with an intermediary release
* +1 this patch and we will switch over the release model
* -1 this patch, but acknowledge a release will be done prior to the
  RC1 deadline.

Change-Id: I3a553d7cb7922ff90ba2b099e023af92a8a85fa9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: order pcmk_remote after Exec['wait-for-settle']
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-12 08:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-03-12 08:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks guys'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-12 09:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-12 08:25:30.000000000', 'message': "order pcmk_remote after Exec['wait-for-settle']

We currently have the following ordering constraints collectors:
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_constraint<||>
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_resource<||>
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_property<||>
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_bundle<||>

The problem here is that on rhel8 remotes are a dedicated puppet resource
'pcmk_remote'. From manifests/resource/remote.pp:
  if $::pacemaker::params::pcs_010 {
    pcmk_remote { $name:
      ensure => $ensure,
...
  } else {
    pcmk_resource { $name:
      ensure => $ensure,

This means that on rhel8 we do not have the guarantee that remotes will be
created after the cluster has settled. This has been observed in a real-life
scenario (the wait-for-settle took place *after* the error):

Mar 12 01:51:05 controller-0.redhat.local puppet-user[27085]: Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Profile::Base::Pacemaker/Pacemaker::Resource::Remote[compute-0]/Pcmk_remote[compute-0]: Could not evaluate: backup_cib: Running: pcs cluster cib /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200312-27084-1ewlz0x failed with code: 1 -> Error: unable to get cib

With this change we did not observe the above error any longer.

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1867105

Change-Id: Id46d22d9a0e4d092c45aed1e90d20669c6808d64
"}]
commit_message:
order pcmk_remote after Exec['wait-for-settle']

We currently have the following ordering constraints collectors:
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_constraint<||>
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_resource<||>
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_property<||>
  Exec<| title == 'wait-for-settle' |> -> Pcmk_bundle<||>

The problem here is that on rhel8 remotes are a dedicated puppet resource
'pcmk_remote'. From manifests/resource/remote.pp:
  if $::pacemaker::params::pcs_010 {
    pcmk_remote { $name:
      ensure => $ensure,
...
  } else {
    pcmk_resource { $name:
      ensure => $ensure,

This means that on rhel8 we do not have the guarantee that remotes will be
created after the cluster has settled. This has been observed in a real-life
scenario (the wait-for-settle took place *after* the error):

Mar 12 01:51:05 controller-0.redhat.local puppet-user[27085]: Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Profile::Base::Pacemaker/Pacemaker::Resource::Remote[compute-0]/Pcmk_remote[compute-0]: Could not evaluate: backup_cib: Running: pcs cluster cib /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200312-27084-1ewlz0x failed with code: 1 -> Error: unable to get cib

With this change we did not observe the above error any longer.

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1867105

Change-Id: Id46d22d9a0e4d092c45aed1e90d20669c6808d64

commit_message:
WIP: refactor: Do network & accel discovery near volumes

As discussed at [1], this pure refactor moves the discovery of network
and accelerator info/metadata/resources from
_validate_and_build_base_options into _provision_instances to be near
corollaries like volume discovery. A couple of other base_options come
along for the ride, for convenience.

WIP: Method signatures changed on the code side, need to be updated on
the test side. Otherwise, this shouldn't require any additional test
work, since it's just a refactor.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631243/55/nova/compute/api.py@1173

Change-Id: I5d0e0ad51dd4d4d800ddd93f0283ee488c130086

commit_message:
Add gating repo to update repos only if it's setup

gating repo is setup only when packages get's build,
so add gating repo to update repos only when gating
repo is setup i.e based on compressed_gating_repo.

Also add new role variable container_prep_additional_repos,
which can be used to add more repos for container updates.

Closes-Bug: #1865459
Change-Id: I9e7b2e04182d156502c1fdb12bcb743d800a6b49

commit_message:
Host OS prechecks follow up

We only log the release in the 'Checking host OS release or version'
precheck, but we allow either the release or version to be included in
the list. For example, on CentOS 7:

    CentOS release Core is not supported. Supported releases are: 8

Include the version in the failure message too.

Change-Id: I0302cd4fc94a0c3a6aa1dbac7b9fedf37c11b81e
Related: blueprint improve-prechecks

[{'created': '2020-03-11 23:45:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix virtualenv detection

This checks if the task failed; which it never does because of the
failed_when: false.  What we want to check is the return value of that
check.

Change-Id: Ic975b53d60f44e8e743bcc31fc864cc8416b3a92
'}]
commit_message:
Fix virtualenv detection

This checks if the task failed; which it never does because of the
failed_when: false.  What we want to check is the return value of that
check.

Change-Id: Ic975b53d60f44e8e743bcc31fc864cc8416b3a92

commit_message:
Amending ntp time sync release note

JayF reminded us in IRC that, while rare, some environments out
there may have misconfigured clock and time zone settings.

Added a note to the release note to highlight this.

Change-Id: Ie7ca2f0a08072aaabafabae9687415c67e291a0f

commit_message:
Trigger molecule jobs once a week

This should prevent us from going for a long time with without knowing that
a specific job got broken.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712473/

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-18 20:02:37.000000000', 'message': 'Handle FIPS 140-2 failure with force_raw

The force_raw option for file downloads and conversions causes the
image file to be reprocessed which changes the image checksum.

In order to properly handle transmission of details to the agent,
We can fallback to using sha256 as a default algorithm by
calculating the checksum using that algorithm and storing the
the value to IPA.

This should allow us to gracefully handle FIPS 140-2 base operating
systems that ironic is running on until we explicitly implement a
fips compliance mode flag to reject all possible use of MD5 and
ensure we are fully compliant to FIPS standards.

Change-Id: I408a2e461bebf1f6d9fa3e350eb7ab1a3544adad
Story: 2007306
Task: 38791
'}, {'created': '2020-02-19 21:34:11.000000000', 'message': "Change force_raw_images to use sha256 if md5 is selected

In order to enable ironic's conductor to execute on nodes
set for FIPS 140-2 compliance, we need to not explicitly
choose MD5.

In the case of forcing images to raw, we were calculating
the checksum at least once, if not twice. Now we will honor
the original algorithm unless it is MD5, at which point we
will default to SHA3-256, and only recalculate the checksum
once.

Change-Id: I408a2e461bebf1f6d9fa3e350eb7ab1a3544adad
Story: 2007306
Task: 38791
"}, {'created': '2020-02-20 19:16:49.000000000', 'message': "Change force_raw_images to use sha256 if md5 is selected

will default to SHA3-256, and only recalculate the checksum
once.

Change-Id: I408a2e461bebf1f6d9fa3e350eb7ab1a3544adad
Story: 2007306
Task: 38791
"}, {'created': '2020-03-06 23:13:20.000000000', 'message': "Change force_raw_images to use sha256 if md5 is selected

commit_message:
Change force_raw_images to use sha256 if md5 is selected

In order to enable ironic's conductor to execute on nodes
set for FIPS 140-2 compliance, we need to not explicitly
choose MD5.

In the case of forcing images to raw, we were calculating
the checksum at least once, if not twice. Now we will honor
the original algorithm unless it is MD5, at which point we
will default to SHA3-256, and only recalculate the checksum
once.

Change-Id: I408a2e461bebf1f6d9fa3e350eb7ab1a3544adad
Story: 2007306
Task: 38791

commit_message:
Enable train, disable rocky and certs fix

Fixes for masakari tests now that patches have landed.

* Add missing default handler for certificates to charm
* Remove rocky from tests until patch lands in packages
* Add train test
* Add release numbers for train and ussuri
* Update tox.ini

Change-Id: Iad3f5403a0eb0124980c249c05c2879c4d9f9bc2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-11 01:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add retry_on_deadlock to migration_update DB API

Lots of different things can be updating the same migration
record at the same time (different computes, the API, etc)
and we see DBDeadlock errors on migration_update at times
(and operators that do a lot of migrations have mentioned it
also) so this change simply adds the retry_on_deadlock decorator
to the migration_update DB API method.

Change-Id: I98bbe96e4be5326e18ef2c2ac50c0d24993d52ec
Closes-Bug: #1642537
(cherry picked from commit 74f9bba9c7ac27df8f73d11fc317649ae22040fb)
(cherry picked from commit 99b3f44eb138b02bd5e967cbbb1574ebcdbc6cc5)
(cherry picked from commit 1f83d773a436c41709b5d6b30a51c979bb935fa2)
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry_on_deadlock to migration_update DB API

Lots of different things can be updating the same migration
record at the same time (different computes, the API, etc)
and we see DBDeadlock errors on migration_update at times
(and operators that do a lot of migrations have mentioned it
also) so this change simply adds the retry_on_deadlock decorator
to the migration_update DB API method.

Change-Id: I98bbe96e4be5326e18ef2c2ac50c0d24993d52ec
Closes-Bug: #1642537
(cherry picked from commit 74f9bba9c7ac27df8f73d11fc317649ae22040fb)
(cherry picked from commit 99b3f44eb138b02bd5e967cbbb1574ebcdbc6cc5)
(cherry picked from commit 1f83d773a436c41709b5d6b30a51c979bb935fa2)

commit_message:
Add disable-password-reveal option

Adds config item to add HORIZON_CONFIG['disable_password_reveal'] = True
option to Horizon's local_settings.py, from Mitaka onwards.  This
prevents the reveal password button from being displayed.

Change-Id: I299f6a6388c3a2ab68cabaeb16e5104ec319e144
Closes-bug: #1840251

commit_message:
Fix DriverFilter string evaluations

When trying to compare two values that are non-numeric using the driver
filter, the filter function will give an error. This is not desirable as
it might be interesting to support comparatives with non-numeric values
provided by the filter objects (volume, host, etc). For example, the
following formula failed before the fix:

filter_function = '(volume.project_id == "bb212f09317a4f4a8952ef3f729c2551")'

Change-Id: Ifc9f2d7cf39c0e497e1ed6440d2be4cda6be12d9

commit_message:
Add new license scheme for Flashsystem9000 series

With this change, cinder driver can create compressed volume on DRP.

Closes-bug: #1863578

Change-Id: I1198c0d07a925d64a4e77b80f4bc22764bfa2f11

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-09 15:43:05.000000000', 'message': '[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c
(cherry picked from commit 3040a61411d70aa7802f8adbc0a75fb0396b6bf1)
'}, {'created': '2020-03-10 14:52:48.000000000', 'message': '[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c
(cherry picked from commit 3040a61411d70aa7802f8adbc0a75fb0396b6bf1)
'}]
commit_message:
[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c
(cherry picked from commit 3040a61411d70aa7802f8adbc0a75fb0396b6bf1)

commit_message:
Granular GET os-instance-actions API policies

This adds 'os_compute_api:os-instance-actions:show' rule,
a new default role in os-instance-actions API policy, and
its default role is 'rule:system_or_project_reader'.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I2ed8e4f28bb80f27e301c28fb4a9816e9ec35830

subject: Support retrying of disconnected DB transactions
messages:
[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-02-25 09:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-02-25 09:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to heat_db_retries'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-02-25 09:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-02-25 09:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-02-25 15:36:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

note that currently in Heat code there is nothing that can use of that option. I'll try to improve that situation in the linked story scope."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-03-05 14:57:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

what's the rationale for this to be optional ?"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-06 14:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think there is no cases for deploying Heat without that capability :)
Shall I hardcode it?'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-03-06 15:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

other serivces like Nova and Neutron do retries unconditionally, making it an option is not the current convention.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-09 14:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-03-10 06:10:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

AFAIK SQLAlchemy automatically reconnects when the connection is lost. 

Looks like this flag only has meaning[1] when the @safe_for_db_retry is used. If we're using @wrap_db_retry (which db uses atm for deadlocks), using retry_on_disconnect=True[2] with @wrap_db_rety should be enough, unless I miss something.

Therefore I'm not sure if this patch is necessary. Also, I've not completely following all changes/discussion in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711075/ where it seems we're not using @safe_for_db_retry and also it seems zzzeek has number of concerns too. Till we sort those out there is no point merging this.


[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/bf5b45ebba24b4c8737c3197f2cd65f84fd2448c/oslo_db/api.py#L275
[2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L98"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-10 12:22:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Looks like this flag only has meaning[1] when the @safe_for_db_retry is used. If we're using @wrap_db_retry (which db uses atm for deadlocks), using retry_on_disconnect=True[2] with @wrap_db_rety should be enough, unless I miss something.

@Rabi, I'm not an Oslo.db expert, but quick looking into its code showed to me the both ways (via @safe wrapper and/or @wrap) are the same and by default there is no disconnects on retrying, whatever of those two methods one uses"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-03-10 13:02:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> @Rabi, I'm not an Oslo.db expert, but quick looking into its code showed to me the both ways (via @safe wrapper and/or @wrap) are the same and by default there is no disconnects on retrying, whatever of those two methods one uses

@Bodgan, I probably don't understand what you mean by 'disconnects on retyring'.

What I'm trying to say is

- 'use_db_reconnect' flag only has significance when @safe_for_db_retry decorator is used[1]

- With @wrap_db_retry decorator which us used by heat atm, if you add retry_on_disconnect=True, it would retry on DBConnectionError[2].

So I am not sure I understand why we're adding this flag, if we're not using @safe_for_db_retry decorator.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/master/oslo_db/api.py#L272-L285

[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/master/oslo_db/api.py#L125-L126"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-10 14:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-11 15:52:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> AFAIK SQLAlchemy automatically reconnects when the connection is lost. 

@Rabi, see oslo.db unit tests illustrating this better https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711221/3/oslo_db/tests/test_api.py :

If we don't set it to retry on disconnects for the wrapper explicitly it won't retry."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-11 15:53:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

this is abandoned because there is no use of it in Heat at the moment.
If we have any progress with the tasks in the story, I'll restore this.

Until then this parameter would remain a disconnected knob :)"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-03-12 03:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> If we don't set it to retry on disconnects for the wrapper explicitly it won't retry.

Sure, I think I mentioned that in my previous comment, quoting again..

"With @wrap_db_retry decorator which is used by heat atm, if you add retry_on_disconnect=True, it would retry on DBConnectionError[[2]"

I've pushed a WIP patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712606/ that you can try and see if it helps with your issues.'}]

commit_message:
Support retrying of disconnected DB transactions

Oslo DB has a special decorator for API methods to indicate either
it is a safe for re-connection to database or not. This only works
in tandem with [database]/use_db_reconnect=True.

Add that use_db_reconnect in order to enable such behavior by default.
This change has no any effect until there is other changes in Heat code
that mark API methods as safe for re-connection to database.

Story: 2007328
task: 38849

Change-Id: I41964d086f197d2a4698e89c7d490c96ccce82ce
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[TRAIN-ONLY] Add systemd-wrapper update tasks

We backported the conversion for the side car containers wrapper tasks
from puppet to ansible in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706381/.
However during a minor update, the deploy step tasks would be run after
the moutnts have been updated. We need to duplicate the deploy step
tasks for the wrapper creation so the mounts exist during the 'overcloud
update run process' as this runs before the 'overcloud update
converge'.

Change-Id: Ia898cb8b1c888aca45ba58ab99e61885a1da4f4e
Closes-Bug: #1866922

commit_message:
rabbitmq: Open ports 25673-25683 for CLI tools

Since RabbitMQ 3.7.4, the CLI tools (rabbitmqctl and friends)
parallelize the querying of information from cluster members.  In
order to receive stream data back, the cli instance binds and
registers itself on an available port (default between 35672 and
35682, inclusive).  If these ports are firewalled off, then
rabbitmqctl commands such as list_queues will hang waiting for data
from remote cluster members.

This patch does two things:

1) Reconfigures rabbitmqctl to bind to 25673-25683 instead of the
default range of 35672-35682.  This ensures the ports are not in the
ephemeral port range and avoids unintended collisions.

2) Opens the firewall on 25673-25683 to enable communication.

Resolves: rhbz#1811680
Closes-Bug: #1866958
Change-Id: If5caa51cd9a3aef97d06d491dde1d5129cc1a569

commit_message:
Remove duplicated topic parts from default value

Ceilometer is adding the topic prefix and suffix automatically, which makes the resulting
topic have the 'ceilometer/' prefix and '.sample' suffix duplicated.

This patch also adds comment to ceilometer env to ensure user deploys Redis for coordination.

Change-Id: I26027cd9b9eb1d166eae52021b1aef9d82a975f3
(cherry picked from commit 2f47252b8e2361343573b20d95172631b4f4f359)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-10 19:35:42.000000000', 'message': 'share_networks: enable project_only API only

At the moment, the share_network database API which the web
API layer interacts with directly does not have any checking
for project_id which means that a user has the ability to run
operations against any other share_network if they have the ID.

This patch implements the usage of project_only in the database
query which ensures that administrators still have the behaviour
of getting any share network they want, but users can only pull
up those which are part of their context/authenticated project.

This patch also adjusts a few other tests due to the fact that
the existing tests would run a lot of inserts with a different
project_id than the context, which is not allowed in this new
API behaviour.  Therefore, the instances that involved projects
different than the context were converted to elevated ones.

There was also an instance where they were being created with a
project_id that did not match the fake context, therefore the
context was adjusted accordingly as well.

Closes-Bug: #1861485
Change-Id: Id67a939a475c4ac06d546b7e095bd10f1a6d2619

commit_message:
share_networks: enable project_only API only

At the moment, the share_network database API which the web
API layer interacts with directly does not have any checking
for project_id which means that a user has the ability to run
operations against any other share_network if they have the ID.

This patch implements the usage of project_only in the database
query which ensures that administrators still have the behaviour
of getting any share network they want, but users can only pull
up those which are part of their context/authenticated project.

This patch also adjusts a few other tests due to the fact that
the existing tests would run a lot of inserts with a different
project_id than the context, which is not allowed in this new
API behaviour.  Therefore, the instances that involved projects
different than the context were converted to elevated ones.

There was also an instance where they were being created with a
project_id that did not match the fake context, therefore the
context was adjusted accordingly as well.

Closes-Bug: #1861485
Change-Id: Id67a939a475c4ac06d546b7e095bd10f1a6d2619
(cherry picked from commit 947315f0903c823b0fdd9d99c60078814587272c)
(cherry picked from commit 496e6e1d2a074ab85f434fe2a88a6c0159696419)
(cherry picked from commit 039ab2b020e4ca13fa723b6cb931f921944894ee)
(cherry picked from commit 496bb1473ea1ad8143bfb65d1727166de543affc)
(cherry picked from commit c3b92b030aa3c0eda2549947df9b752c7393849e)
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Refactor ks-user HTK script

This change refactors the ks-user helm-toolkit script
to reduce the number of calls to keystone for domains
or projects that already exist. Also added in a case
to check if the role is admin to avoid superfluous
API calls.

Change-Id: Ic4811e668ee1daed194bb4996baadc43aa742d3a

commit_message:
Finalize removal of ipxe_enabled option

Remove the dynamically registered ipxe_enabled option and say goodbye.
Further extracts common bits to the PXEBaseMixin, tuning tests here and
there.

Story: 2007003
Task: 37779

Change-Id: I7c1b2a984d45bd63b4e95b62ce02960924c2ce17

commit_message:
Add Certmonger ceph_rgw class to config tls

This patch adds the ceph_rgw class required by certmonger to
create the cert/key.
This patch also creates the service_pem file since the rgw
container private key, public certificate and any other CA or
intermediate certificates should be in one file, in PEM format.

Change-Id: I960f7c48866ef11e58e63d80217f7df660455fe1
(cherry picked from commit 7013cd94ee1c1f373814e8a77885a23c6845e86d)

commit_message:
Automate generation of quotas api-ref samples

This patch adds the following tests:
1) quota sets
2) quota classes

Change-Id: Ie52071c0b69b49eee340ebf4b06446e824c4b5fe
Partially-Implements: blueprint generating-sample-files

commit_message:
Flatten and sort package removal list

To make the package list easier to read and maintain,
we flatten the command and sort the list alphanumerically.

Change-Id: I233b43633ae38c84af14cfd1b8296f6475a2902b

commit_message:
sonobuoy: add role-exec

This role enables the readonly serviceaccount to additionally perform
pod/exec within the configured namespace.

Some organizations deploy pods in a particular namespace in Kubernetes
that have a locked down user/CLI that allows examining resources with
readonly access (to prevent any modifications, etc.). This change
enables the Sonobuoy plugins to leverage these pods by executing into
them.

Change-Id: I781248fdd251e7fca31e0ab831326a9f475392cd

subject: Make sure we create stonith resources before stonith levels
messages:
[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-07 14:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-10 15:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-11 06:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-11 13:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-11 21:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit cbf11f05d461c9519a266f4cda91f01ad585d5c7'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-07 14:10:17.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we create stonith resources before stonith levels

Currently stonith levels kind of work out of pure luck. If puppet
decides to reorder resources stonith levels can fail with:

            "Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Fencing/Pacemaker::Stonith::Level[stonith-1-525400e05b23]/Pcmk_stonith_level[stonith-level-1-$(/usr/sbin/crm_node -n)-stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200305-60559-tn9ici create failed: Error: Stonith resource(s) 'stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23' do not exist, use --force to override"

Nowhere in the code do we mandate that the single stonith resources need
to be created *before* the stonith levels which make use of them.
Let's add a constraint via collectors so we enforce this ordering.

Tested on the environment that was not working and got a correctly
deployed IHA overcloud.

Change-Id: I78cb6ae21366a429b65a8357b3b267a485484a42
Closes-Bug: #1866214
(cherry picked from commit b706f5365a84712eea8a133a9b8029878dcec2d2)
'}, {'created': '2020-03-11 06:26:51.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we create stonith resources before stonith levels

Currently stonith levels kind of work out of pure luck. If puppet
decides to reorder resources stonith levels can fail with:

            "Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Fencing/Pacemaker::Stonith::Level[stonith-1-525400e05b23]/Pcmk_stonith_level[stonith-level-1-$(/usr/sbin/crm_node -n)-stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200305-60559-tn9ici create failed: Error: Stonith resource(s) 'stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23' do not exist, use --force to override"

Nowhere in the code do we mandate that the single stonith resources need
to be created *before* the stonith levels which make use of them.
Let's add a constraint via collectors so we enforce this ordering.

Tested on the environment that was not working and got a correctly
deployed IHA overcloud.

Change-Id: I78cb6ae21366a429b65a8357b3b267a485484a42
Closes-Bug: #1866214
(cherry picked from commit b706f5365a84712eea8a133a9b8029878dcec2d2)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure we create stonith resources before stonith levels

Currently stonith levels kind of work out of pure luck. If puppet
decides to reorder resources stonith levels can fail with:

            "Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Fencing/Pacemaker::Stonith::Level[stonith-1-525400e05b23]/Pcmk_stonith_level[stonith-level-1-$(/usr/sbin/crm_node -n)-stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200305-60559-tn9ici create failed: Error: Stonith resource(s) 'stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23' do not exist, use --force to override"

Nowhere in the code do we mandate that the single stonith resources need
to be created *before* the stonith levels which make use of them.
Let's add a constraint via collectors so we enforce this ordering.

Tested on the environment that was not working and got a correctly
deployed IHA overcloud.

Change-Id: I78cb6ae21366a429b65a8357b3b267a485484a42
Closes-Bug: #1866214
(cherry picked from commit b706f5365a84712eea8a133a9b8029878dcec2d2)

commit_message:
Fix manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-centos-7 job


The "centos-release-openstack-pike" yum package used by this job
to pull for devstack to pull in rabbitmq-server has been removed [1]
resulting in a failure:


TASK [Add centos-release-openstack-pike support]
primary | ERROR
primary | {
primary |   "msg": "No package matching 'centos-release-openstack-pike' found available, installed or updated",
primary |   "rc": 126,
primary |   "results": [
primary |     "No package matching 'centos-release-openstack-pike' found available, installed or updated"
primary |   ]
primary | }

Update manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-centos-7 job to install openstack
queens package instead of pike.

[1] https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2019-August/035828.html

Change-Id: I9945e5acc5e9bba88c8cf66e84011ead8b1de13b
(cherry picked from commit 6fbfc888722f5f87c3fab54b910d7f08feb7425a)
(cherry picked from commit fdacc1e908b50ac66b5027e1f427dfdec99cfd34)

> (1 comment)

Ok, many thanks for clarifying that. You're right, the convention is to have the main package named python-*. And without a py2 variant, we don't have an associated binary RPM with the main package. And I guess you're also replacing the use of the %python_subpackages single-spec macro by moving all the runtime requirements from the main package to an explicit python3-* sub-package."}, {'account_id': 22595, 'date': '2019-12-13 15:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2020-01-09 11:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-01-14 17:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-01-15 10:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

subject: Switch mariadb netpol over to feature gate
messages:
[{'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-01-09 16:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-01-09 17:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-01-09 17:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2020-01-09 19:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

As we transition to using the feature gate functionality, is it our end goal to consolidate as many deployment scripts as possible in tools/deployment/common? 

If so, do we want to continue making symlinks to those scripts from our job-specific directories? Or would we want to update jobs.yaml to directly reference these "base" deployment scripts?

Just wondering what the pattern should be going forward. Your thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-01-09 19:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > As we transition to using the feature gate functionality, is it our
 > end goal to consolidate as many deployment scripts as possible in
 > tools/deployment/common?
 > 
 > If so, do we want to continue making symlinks to those scripts from
 > our job-specific directories? Or would we want to update jobs.yaml
 > to directly reference these "base" deployment scripts?
 > 
 > Just wondering what the pattern should be going forward. Your
 > thoughts?

The plan is to directly reference the scripts in common and get rid of the network-policy ones. Basically this: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689597/'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-03-11 20:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Switch mariadb netpol over to feature gate

This change moves the mariadb netpol script over to using the
feature gate functionality.

Change-Id: I92cd9786f60e7bac72c4f45ac7101bea4287e37a

commit_message:
Reduce duplication in molecule job defs

We can use the yaml merge operator to merge the file lists together to
reduce the duplicated items in the molecule job defintions.

Change-Id: I5f5da7bcfa50b9c4c5200504a1b5128b2a7716e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-11 09:57:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HAProxy monitor VIP precheck

If haproxy is running somewhere in the cluster and listening on the VIP,
but not running locally, then the following precheck may fail:

   TASK [haproxy : Checking free port for HAProxy monitor (vip interface)]

   msg: Timeout when waiting for 192.0.2.10:61313 to stop.

This change fixes the issue by skipping the check if HAProxy is running
on any host.

Change-Id: I831eb2f700ef3fcf65b7e08382c3b4fcc4ce8d8d
Closes-Bug: #1866617
(cherry picked from commit 93a4dcc1b97b1d7bbd3b91cc9c4bd4617ec6f9ba)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HAProxy monitor VIP precheck

If haproxy is running somewhere in the cluster and listening on the VIP,
but not running locally, then the following precheck may fail:

   TASK [haproxy : Checking free port for HAProxy monitor (vip interface)]

   msg: Timeout when waiting for 192.0.2.10:61313 to stop.

This change fixes the issue by skipping the check if HAProxy is running
on any host.

Change-Id: I831eb2f700ef3fcf65b7e08382c3b4fcc4ce8d8d
Closes-Bug: #1866617
(cherry picked from commit 93a4dcc1b97b1d7bbd3b91cc9c4bd4617ec6f9ba)

overcloud: set DeployIdentifier to '' if --skip-deploy-identifier is used

Similar to Ib1928b60ba7b03983f303577a53df078d32d2b1b, ensure that
DeployIdentifier is empty if --skip-deploy-identifier is used.

(cherry picked from commit 5685cd24afa6ae9940c2f30b549be881725efe9f)

commit_message:
Revert "Remove neutron wrappers"

This patch broke some deployments not having the latest THT
which configure the new wrappers; we shouldn't have removed
that code in Train and leave it.
We need to respect the stable policy and keep this code around for Train.

Closes-Bug: #1866920
This reverts commit 19f0181d8325113d751611de099f4fc5ee8323b6.

Change-Id: I13434d961e72a944e49e3ddba2ec512d4d786690

ujson 2.0.1 has a python dependacy of the library 'double-conversion'

Change-Id: Ie83b41e129942ad8255fed5fb14ab328c2943a77
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure g++ is present on debian/ubuntu for wheel builds

ujson 2.0.1 has a python dependacy of the library 'double-conversion'
which requires a C++ compiler to build. Ensure that g++ is available
which also ensures that the gcc compiler is present.

Change-Id: Ie83b41e129942ad8255fed5fb14ab328c2943a77

commit_message:
Add NTP time sync

Attempt to sync the clock and save it to the hardware clock.

This feature supports use of chrony or ntpdate.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I178d7614429d582e742d9cba6d0fa3ae099775e3
Story: 1619054
Task: 11591

commit_message:
Remove stray conditional from aodh-evaluator tasks

In Ib4c59302ad5ad64f23419cd69ee9b2a80333924e a conditional
was moved incorrectly and left as a stray. Luckily it is
only a cosmetic issue, but it might be confusing when doing
any maintenance work so it's better to remove it.

Change-Id: Iac3cbf23437bb11ec47dd1a0f189babe0c5587d0
(cherry picked from commit edd10576ca33337b09070da204a88d189456a5e2)
(cherry picked from commit e04f031b811086ff5805b7ead19d1a019a9fe77b)

Helm-Toolkit: Change Ingrsess Service template

Change _service-ingress.tpl to make the services to headless 
services if Ingress IP is not provided.

commit_message:
Skip clean steps from 'fake' interfaces in the documentation

They are not targeted at operators, and the title 'fake cleaning
steps' is confusing.

Change-Id: Ibe42ede09fcbc5d8c16c8b1996f6c4055ad6a138

"}, {'created': '2020-01-23 11:32:51.000000000', 'message': "nova-net: Remove unused nova-network objects

With the removal of the related quotas, the 'FixedIP', 'FloatingIP',
'SecurityGroupRule', and 'NetworkList' objects can all be deleted. As
noted previously, the 'SecurityGroup' object must be retained until we
bump the 'Instance' object version to v3 and drop the 'security_group'
field, while the 'Network' object must be retained until we figure out
how to move it to 'os-vif' where it's still needed. For the latter case,
we are able to remove a lot of the remoteable methods that aren't used
anymore (and haven't been for some time) as well as the persistent
mixin. This results in a change in the hash which is fine since the
fields themselves haven't changed.

Change-Id: I6aba959eff1e50af4ac040148c7177f235a09a1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-01-23 12:10:21.000000000', 'message': "nova-net: Remove unused nova-network objects

With the removal of the related quotas, the 'FixedIP', 'FloatingIP',
'SecurityGroupRule', 'Network' and 'NetworkList' objects can all be
deleted. As noted previously, the 'SecurityGroup' object must be
retained until we bump the 'Instance' object version to v3 and drop the
'security_group' field. In addition, we need to make a small change to
the object versioning test to ensure we're only testing objects in the
nova namespace. If we don't do this, we end up pulling in things like
os_vif objects. This was previously noted in change
Ica9f217d0318fc7c2db4bcdea12d00aad749c30c.

Change-Id: I6aba959eff1e50af4ac040148c7177f235a09a1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove unused nova-network objects

With the removal of the related quotas, the 'FixedIP', 'FloatingIP',
'SecurityGroupRule', 'Network' and 'NetworkList' objects can all be
deleted. As noted previously, the 'SecurityGroup' object must be
retained until we bump the 'Instance' object version to v3 and drop the
'security_group' field. In addition, we need to make a small change to
the object versioning test to ensure we're only testing objects in the
nova namespace. If we don't do this, we end up pulling in things like
os_vif objects. This was previously noted in change
Ica9f217d0318fc7c2db4bcdea12d00aad749c30c.

Change-Id: I6aba959eff1e50af4ac040148c7177f235a09a1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Handle unset 'connection_info'

As noted inline, it's possible for this to be unset if a boot from
volume request failed early in the process.

Change-Id: I06a67355baaa493313aea83b198d2bce620074db
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1730549

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove unnecessary exception handling, mocks

With the removal of nova-network, a whole swathe of exceptions are no
longer raised on certain code paths. Start cleaning things up by
removing these. Some of these features can be removed now while the
remainder will be removed once we have removed the (now unused) code
that calls them.

Change-Id: I131062ded9ddedc31cf3b448b2c38306b55e874b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

I feel like we've made this slightly more complicated, but this is a complicated topic when we look at all of the possible moving parts."}, {'account_id': 28543, 'date': '2019-10-14 04:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2019-10-14 07:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-10-16 10:46:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

Something that caused a long discussion on one patch already is this question: what are we going to use to configure networking? If we use os-net-config, we just install it and use. It is developed by people who have a good clue how things work.

The proposed patch, however, implements the Nova format handling from scratch. I'm not really fond of us impelementing and supporting network configuration for all operating systems that IPA is commonly built on (TinyCore, CentOS/RHEL 7, CentOS/RHEL 8, Debian and probably Ubuntu and OpenSUSE). Can we find a library that does it? I doubt it, since the format is OpenStack-specific, but have you tried?

Otherwise, are we okay with increasing the scope of ironic with our own network configuration tool? I'm personally not okay. Our team is not increasing (if not decreasing), we lack networking expertise on our core team, we lack expertise in various operating systems. How are we going to address this?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-10-16 11:06:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

Oh, I have a compromise idea! What if we write a convertor from Nova format to os-net-config? Then we'd achieve the same functinality without getting into business of network configuration."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-10-16 11:37:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(13 comments)

Leaving a bunch of comments in case we decide to proceed with this approach.'}, {'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2019-10-16 13:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(29 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-10-16 15:25:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

> Oh, I have a compromise idea! What if we write a convertor from Nova format to os-net-config? Then we'd achieve the same functinality without getting into business of network configuration.

We can do that, and have that converter embedded into the ramdisk. Other images might just use cloud-init.

However, would the introduction of the new tool and embedding os-net-config be reasonably justified considering limited networking functionality that ramdisk needs?

My current script [1] that seems to work in TinyCore does not do anything beyond iproute2 calls. I hope it should work in practically any Linux distro...

Thoughts?

I kind of like the compromise idea in that the native metadata format is fine. Forging it is fairly forgiving if we need to generate our own or if an operator is going to create a blob to be sent over instead because they need to declare the port. I'm kind of at the point where I feel like a compromise to eventually get to xyz, even if the first pass for initial development is not perfect or what we all want. Bottom line is we can iterate and don't need to get everything perfect on the initial patch or in the design document.

I will state that I'm really not a fan of os-net-config because it came from TripleO and focuses on interfaces by name for a deployed instance. One can provide mappings, but the network_data.json model focuses on more "the mac is the interface".'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-10-18 08:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:
